intro: Quilesia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Quilesia is native to Central and South America but has been introduced to other tropical regions. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
